column4: I have tried the media thingy that came with GNOME that I hated, mplayer, vlc, and amaroK.
Which player are you using? Concerning the wmv-problems
Did you install mplayer and win32codecs?
if you start mplayer from a console, can you paste the debug messages into a pastebin?
I mean, a debug message when you are trying to decode a WMV of course
Glad I could give you emotional support
now I just wish someone could help me with my problem. How to get openVPN support into the ubuntu/gnome networkmanager.
You can write your own little shell script first scping and then rming :)
-- Because people who run VPNs are smart enough to use ttys for configuration?  :D

I have no problems configuring openvpn, but I think having a nice little button to start it instead of firing up a shell and do it manually, is a good idea. And since I am using network-manager for WLAN settings already and plugins do exist outside the Ubuntu world, I'd very much like to use it.
